body.name: The Overnight Guest
body.description: NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER “Fully realized, wholly absorbing and almost painfully suspenseful...The journey is mesmerizing.” —New York TimesA woman receives an unexpected visitor during a deadly snowstorm in this chilling thriller from New York Times bestselling author Heather Gudenkauf. True crime writer Wylie Lark doesn’t mind being snowed in at the isolated farmhouse where she’s retreated to write her new book. A cozy fire, complete silence. It would be perfect, if not for the fact that decades earlier, at this very house, two people were murdered in cold blood and a girl disappeared without a trace. As the storm worsens, Wylie finds herself trapped inside the house, haunted by the secrets contained within its walls—haunted by secrets of her own. Then she discovers a small child in the snow just outside. After bringing the child inside for warmth and safety, she begins to search for answers. But soon it becomes clear that the farmhouse isn’t as isolated as she thought, and someone is willing to do anything to find them.Don’t miss Heather’s upcoming twisty locked-room thriller, EVERYONE IS WATCHING!And don't miss these other great stories by Heather! The Weight of Silence These Things Hidden Little Mercies MIssing Pieces Not a Sound Before She Was Found This is How I Lied Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a thriller! 5 stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️. Highly recommended
reviews.reviewText: Wow what a thriller! I love the descriptive setting, plot, and characters. This book never gets flat but yet there’s no extreme twists, it’s just written perfectly with a great pace. This thriller was pretty disturbing and a bit sad which gave this some substance which is kind of rare in a thriller. There’s heart in this thriller. Great book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Gripping who done it.
reviews.reviewText: Wylie is a true crime murder mystery writer, who is writing a book in a small town in the very home the murder occurred. She’s putting the finishing touches to the book in the face of a terrible winter storm that leaves her stranded with no electricity or phone service.I came into reading this book knowing nothing about it, not having read any reviews. I wasn’t sure if this was a ghost story as well after she finds a small child half frozen in her yard during the storm, who is terrified and mute.Events unfold slowly, the story is told in pieces from the different perspectives of the characters involved, switching from the past events leading up to and including the murders, to present day repercussions. There is a disturbing part where a young woman with a child is being help captive a la ‘Room’ that ties into the story.There are twists which are very good, but I figured them out before they were revealed. I like being surprised, but it was still really good story telling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A new favorite author to obsess over
reviews.reviewText: Heather Gudenkauf is not a new author by any means but as only started reading thrillers a couple years ago she is one I was not familiar with—until she became a bonus buddy read for my group. I am now obsessed and will need to consume and collect every one of her books for my trophy shelf.This story is well plotted and well written. It kept me hooked page after page and I couldn’t get wait to get to the end to see it all unfold.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Jackson Henley wasn't explain ed in the book's ending. He didn't kill anyone. And I'm not sure why Rant killed the Doyle family

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't wild about this read; but, it was okay. It didn't live up to the review; but, I only read one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Wylie is a crime story writer who is staying at an old farm house that was a crime scene years ago. Story goes back in time to crime being committed and then to present with Wylie along with another story happening in the present. Very much a page turner!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is the 1st book I’ve read from the author and it was wonderful. I read it during winter and the isolated ambiance and freezing temps of the book was just perfect: The author did a great job of telling different stories and bringing it all together in the end!

WOW, did this novel ever grab me from page 1, my fingers madly flipping thru the pages to the exciting end!I KNEW from the first chapter, I would love this book...fast paced, great chapter length, compelling characters, rapid plot thickening, great twists!After I finished the last page and closed my book, I just said, WOW, what a great story, fabulous read. This book was highly recommended on a book forum I belong to, everyone loved it, and I too will be raving about it, as well.A new to me author, whose work I will be buying more of!

No recuerdo porque comore este libro, creo que porque leí de libros de terror o algo así en un correo que me envio la empresa que publica el libro, que bueno que le di la oportunidad, el libro muy bueno, hay varios giros en la trama que si te imaginas que vienen pero cuando los lees no te sientes decepcionado, sino feliz de que todo encaje y que la historia sea tan buena. Lo recomiendo mucho su quieres una historia rápida y buena!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really good book. Could not put it down! Highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Entertaining read despite a pretty cliche ending
reviews.reviewText: This is a very good and entertaining thriller. The only disappointment comes, as often with thrillers, at the end, with a very cliche finale.

reviews.reviewTitle: Three Types Of Locked Room in One Book
reviews.reviewText: Told in three points of view ( present day, Wylie - a writer in a secluded farmhouse in a snowstorm; past, Josie - enduring a family tragedy; and a young girl held captive with her mother in a basement (think: Room), this story weaves a narrative over the lives of those affected by a shocking crime.I found I managed to race through this one, the writing really set the scenes, especially as the environments are so different from my usual ones. A slight criticism in that the ending was a bit too cutesy all winding up nicely, but it suited the purpose, so, meh.
